intro: Conopodium hirtulum, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it often grows in disturbed soils along roadsides and in open fields. The hairy texture of its stems and leaves is a distinguishing feature of this species.
